fields.description:
It seems after JIRA upgrade a functionality from previous version related to JIRA created vs resolved chart gadgets is not available anymore.

When there was a chart and the user clicked on Maximize, from the chart it was possible to go to a table with information per each period (weeks, in my case).

We cannot do this anymore.

I was using this to create projections of outflow/inflow/backlog, it was extremely useful to quickly get historical data. If I have to do it manually I do not see an easy way without heavier data manipulation in Excel after export.

!NFR2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bring back canvas for Created vs Resolved gadget.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

{{<JIRA>/status}} returns _ERROR_ during full re-indexing (foreground reindexing). 
 This makes a host that is doing a full re-index is indistinguishable from a host that is not healthy (i.e. not live) and needs restarting.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start 'Lock JIRA and rebuild index' (make sure you have enough issues to reindex)
 # Trigger call to {{<JIRA>/status}}

h3. Expected Results

HTTP code: *200* 
 Body:
{code:java}
{"state":"MAINTENANCE"}
{code}
h3. Actual Results

HTTP code: *500* or *503*
 Body:
{code:java}
{"state":"ERROR"}
{code}
h3. Notes
 * Same "ERROR" status was not reproducible in earlier Jira version like Jira v7.2.12
 * Background reindex returns "RUNNING" status

h3. Workaround

None

h3. Note on fix
The behaviour of this endpoint in versions of Jira containing this fix is (from comment below):
* No Johnson event, or a Johnson event which doesn't prevent startup: 200, "STARTING"/"FIRST_RUN"/"RUNNING"
* Startup is delayed by a reIndexing event, and nothing else: 503, "MAINTENANCE"
* Startup is prevented by a different Johnson event: 500, "ERROR"
fields.summary: /status url returns ERROR instead of MAINTENANCE during foreground reindexing

fields.description:
h2. Background
The [Advanced searching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/advanced-searching-939938733.html] documentation provides users with instructions on how to build JQL queries. However, not many examples are provided, and this makes it hard for users to apply advanced searching JQL to their use case.

h2. Suggestion
* Provide more examples, preferably a few examples ranging from a simple to more complex (combination of arguments) JQLs for each function.
* Also include examples of limitations within the JQL
fields.summary: Update JQL Advanced Searching documentation with more examples

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When importing tickets from Redmine, "Target Version" in Redmine ticket is mapped to Fix Version" in Jira issue.

According to our doc [Importing data from Redmine|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-redmine-938847599.html], it should mapped to "Affects Version" instead.

After [JIM-898|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JIM-898] is implemented, it seems to be changed.

h3. Suggested Solution

Please update the document based on the latest spec.
fields.summary: Documentation about Redmine Importer

fields.description:
h3. Problem. 

From *Administration > System Info > Cluster Nodes* we can see offline nodes listed as ACTIVE when node is shutdown ungracefully.

!node.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # install JDC with two nodes (node1, node2)
 # force kill (kill -9) node1

h3. Expected outcome
 * node1 should listed as OFFLINE in UI and database

h3. Actual outcome
 * killed node still listed as ACTIVE 
 * in the database, we see 

{code:java}
jira763=# select * from clusternode;
 node_id | node_state | timestamp | ip | cache_listener_port | node_build_number | node_version
----------------+------------+---------------+-----------+---------------------+-------------------+--------------
 node1 | ACTIVE | 1523489152849 | atlassian.com | 40001 | 76005 | 7.6.3
 node2 | ACTIVE | 1523562548096 | atlassian.com | 40001 | 76005 | 7.6.3
(4 rows){code}
 
  

Note this is just UI problem, but the shutdown node is no longer actively communicating with the cluster.
fields.summary: JIRA Data Center node appear as Active when shutdown ungracefully

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If unwanted e-mails reach a mailbox that is being used by a mail handler in Jira, there is no way to filter out these messages on the application level.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to blacklist specific domains in the mail handler configuration.

h3. Why this is important
This allows Jira admins to filter out specific domains that might be flooding the mailbox. 

h3. Workaround 
Filter out the unwanted messages in the mailbox using rules/filters.
fields.summary: Add option to filter e-mails by domain

fields.description: As a Jira Administrators, I would like to have the ability to retrieve groups from LDAP before users login for the first time, so Project Administrators can have Project Roles and Permissions already configured beforehand.
fields.summary: Fetch LDAP Groups on Delegated Directory

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Troubleshooting and Support app collects logs that contain user data which may be considered sensitive data. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Anonymize/scramble user data included in the logs. 

h3. Why this is important

Some organizations have security requirements in place that include anonymizing any user identifiable data in the logs before sending them to support.
 
h3. Workaround 

Develop an in-house script to scramble desired user data.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I would like the Troubleshooting and Support app to anonymize user data in logs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Field is not being updated after adding "update issue field" post function to "create issue" transition in workflow. 

h3. Steps to reproduce 

Goal is to set all issue resolution field to "Done" in  "Done" project when issues were moved from other projects to "Done" project regardless what was the issue resolution before. 
 # Create new workflow
 # In "Create Issue", add post function "update issue field" to transition
 # Select "Resolution" as "Done". Add post function. 

!UpdateissuePostfunction.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected result

When moving issues from other project to "Done" project, resolution should be set to "Done" automatically after adding "update issue field" post function. 

h3. Actual result

When moving issues to the "Done" project with the "update issue field" post function to update the "resolution" to "Done", the "resolution" is unchanged and remains "unresolved"

h3. Workaround 

we recommend to use the "Automation Life for Jira" plugin(it's free) to automatic the transition, update resolution to "Done" when you move the issue from any project to the "Trash" project. 
 [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugin.automation.jira-automation-plugin/server/overview]

*Here is the step by step guide to set up the automation rules*
 # Install "Automation Life for Jira" plugin.
 # Create automation rule. Select "Multiple issue events"-> "Issue moved". (Make sure to select from "Multiple issue events" as "issue moved "pro" is not free)
 !automationRule.png|thumbnail!
 Note: If you check the box "Execute this rule immediately when the rule is triggered, instead of in the background", when the issue is moved to "Trash" project, the resolution will be set to "Done". If the box is unchecked, you will need to refresh the page of the issue inside of "Trash" project in order to reflect the changes.
 # In the JQL condition, enter JQL as "project = 'resolution' AND resolution IS EMPTY" !JQLCondition.png|thumbnail!
 # Edit issue fields "resolution" to "Done". 

          !updateresolution.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Update issue field transition is not working for create issue transition

fields.description:
Summary
When upgrading from 7.8.x to 7.9 the 'you've just been upgraded!' screen shows the incorrect date of upgrade.

Steps to Reproduce
Upgrade from any 7.8.x release to the 7.9 release
Note the time/date of the upgrade shows the time/date of the 7.8.x release and not the 7.9.

Expected Results
Page should show the date/time of the latest patch to avoid confusion in regard to the integrity of the upgrade.

Actual Results
Date of the 7.8.x release is shown instead of the 7.9 version.
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-12 at 13.38.26.png|thumbnail!

Notes
* The upgradeversionhistory table has no record of the 7.9 version.
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-12 at 13.36.47.png|thumbnail!
* The following logs are not shown when upgrading the Jira instance
{code:title=atlassian-jira.log}
...
*******************************************************************
Upgrade Succeeded! JIRA has been upgraded to build number XXXXX
*******************************************************************
...
{code}
* Also, there is no upgrade history information in the log (after upgrading to 7.9.x)
{code}
...
    ___ Upgrade History ________________________
    
         7.8.2#77001
              Time Performed                                : 2018-04-27 06:56:46.83
...
{code}

Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: You've just been upgraded page shows wrong date for major releases

export JIRA_HOME=/Users/piotrs/dev/atlassian/atlassian-jira-software-7.9.0-standalone-home

rm -rf ../atlassian-jira-software-7.9.0-standalone-home/*

fields.summary: Include JIRA Core License into JIRA Software License

fields.description:
h5. Summary

Indexes with large number of terms (unique pairs of field name and it's values) cause extensive memory allocation each time an issue is being reindexed. On every commit to Lucene index TermInfosReader is regenerated. It contains several large arrays: terms, term infos and index pointers. This situation leads to frequent humongous allocations on G1-enabled instances.

h5. Steps to reproduce

Provide instance with index containing large amount of unique terms (millions) and reindex issues several times.

h5. Actual results

Each commit to Lucene index causes extensive memory allocation. 
On G1-enabled instances it can lead to humongous allocations.

h5. Expected results

Commit to Lucene index does not lead to humongous allocations.

h5. Notes

Allocation rates observed on large instances:
- Number of terms in Issues index: more than 100mln
- Lucene builds terms index for every 128th term
- Number of objects in each of TermInfosReader's arrays: 100mln / 128 = ~780k 
- Retained heap observed in heap dumps: ~130mb

h5. Workaround

There is no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Extensive memory allocation for indexes with large number of terms

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Here's the scenario:

1. Create few subtasks directly in Epic
2. Go to Kanban backlog -> subtasks will be visible
3. Select the same Epic

Result -> subtasks not visible.

If you do the same using a story which is assigned to an Epic, the story and it subtasks will be visible
fields.summary: Epics subtasks not visible on kanban backlog

h3. Summary When you drag a subtask on an epic You can't add sub-tasks to epics.

Sub-tasks are automatically associated with the same epic as their parent issues.
fields.summary: tags in message

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Pointing a newer Jira version at an older Jira database (e.g. 7.9 Jira application to a Jira 7.0 database) does not update the column data types.

h3. Suggested Solution
The database columns should be updated according to the entity definition, so that customers aren't forced to rely solely on the upgrade via XML import method.

see also: [How to Fix the Column is of type TEXT in the database but defined as LONGTEXT in the entity definition Error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-fix-the-column-is-of-type-text-in-the-database-but-defined-as-longtext-in-the-entity-definition-error-330794040.html]

h3. Workaround
Jira customers are currently instructed to install empty database instances and then import Jira data using an XML-based import process (that is, XML backup/restore)
fields.summary: In-place Upgrade via DB method should change column data types within DB

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Administrators are not able to save the Description of WebHooks. The Description gets removed upon refreshing the WebHooks page or navigating to a different page.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create or edit an existing WebHooks and add a description and save it.
# Refresh the page or navigate to a different page.
# Go back to the WebHooks page (if navigating away).

h3. Actual results
The description is lost.

h3. Expected results
Jira keeps the description.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at this time.

h3. Note
Table AO_4AEACD_WEBHOOK_DAO that stores WebHooks config doesn't seem to have a column for storing WebHooks Description.
fields.summary: Unable to save webhooks description
Add ability to search for @mentions, or even the same functionality in jira that confluence already has that shows the notifications including @mentions in JIRA.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

 A session timeout error is shown when bulk editing sub-tasks. It happens only when selecting bulk edit by clicking on the (...) button above the sub-tasks list inside a parent issue (see screenshot below).
 
h3. Environment

There is no specific environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue with sub-tsks
 # Above the list of sub-tasks click on (...) > Bulk Operation
 # Select all sub-tasks and click on next

h3. Expected Results

 

The page to select the bulk operation should appear
h3. Actual Results

This one appears on jlog
{code:java}
/secure/views/bulkedit/BulkMigrateSetFields.jspa [c.a.j.w.a.issue.bulkedit.BulkMigrate] Bulk edit bean unexpectedly null. Perhaps session was lost (e.g. when URL used is different to base URL in General Configuration)?{code}
 
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Potential Workaround
 # Go to Issues > Search for issues
 # Search for parent issue (parent = TEST-1), it’ll list all sub-tasks
 # Click Tools > Bulk Change > all x issue(s)
fields.summary: Session timeout while bulk editing sub-tasks

fields.summary: JIRA Stops working after restoring image from production to Preprod  (Version : v6.4.12#64027-sha1:e3691cc)

fields.description: I think it would be a useful improvement if Jira added an option to add phone numbers of users into the User's Account information from the Directory so that it can be accessed by project fields.  I have tried using Add-ons which have not worked, but it would by nice if Jira could do this out of the box.
fields.summary: Phone number accessible from User Directory for an issue field's value

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Searching with Text containing multiple Underscores didn't return any results. 
This is not related to custom fields, the same behavior is seen in Summary field as well.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Create an issue with Summary: Aaa_Bbb66_Ccc_Ddd_123.
# Search issue by Summary.

h3. *Testing*
| *Search string* | *Result* |
| aaa | (/) |
| bbb66 | (x) |
| ccc | (/) |
| ddd | (x) |
| 123 | (x) |
| aaa_ | (/) |
| aaa_bbb | (/) |
| aaa_bbb_ | (/) |
| aaa_bbb_ccc | (/) |
| aaa_bbb_ccc_ | (/) |
| aaa_bbb_ccc_ddd | (x) |
| aaa_bbb_ccc_ddd_ | (x) |
| aaa_bbb_ccc_ddd_123 | (x) |
| bbb_ccc | (/) |
| ccc_ddd | (x) |


h3. *Conclusion*
The search seems to be valid until the third underscore only. Also words mixed with letters and numbers searches doesn't work properly.

h3. *[Update: 18 April 2018]*
It seems that period "." also having the same issue as underscore "_".
fields.summary: Searching with Text containing multiple Underscores or Period didn't return any results

fields.description: We have users in several locales and some teams require 24-hour format instead of AM/PM. The power should be given to the user to select the time format THEY need instead of what the admin dictates.
fields.summary: Time format should be set by user instead of system wide.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Given that the Description field can be moved within the Configure Screens functionality, a user would expect the View/Edit Issue screen to respect the re-ordering of fields from their configuration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Following the Jira Server documentation, [Defining a screen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/defining-a-screen-938847288.html], 
# Log in as a user with the Jira Administrators global permission.
# Choose  > Issues. Select Screens to open the View Screens page.
# Click the Configure link next to the screen for which you want to re-order fields
# Move the Description field:  Hover over the dotted part of the field (next to Description) and drag the field to the desired position.

h3. Expected Results
Upon saving the screen, the screen should show the Description field in the order it was configured.

h3. Actual Results
The Description field allows displays below the other fields within the screen


h3. Notes
Within the Jira documentation, [Defining a screen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/defining-a-screen-938847288.html], the following lines describe the possible limitation:

bq.*System fields on View Issue screen* — System fields on the default 'View Issue' screen (e.g. Summary, Security Level, Issue Type, etc.) are fixed. This means that they will always appear in the same place on the 'View Issue' screen, even if you configure the Screen to move them onto a separate tab. Custom fields of related to Dates and People will also appear in their fixed section of the view issue screen. If none of the fields on a tab contain data then the tab is not shown. To make a tab show up, make sure it has a custom field with a type such as Text or Select and that the field has a value. Note, this information only applies to the screen associated with the 'View Issue' operation in a screen scheme.

If there is a limitation for Description since it is a system field, there should be a message when a user attempts to re-order that field or a modification to the Jira Configure Screen UI

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround
fields.summary: Moving Description field on Config Screen is not respected within View/Edit Issue

fields.description:
As a JIRA administrator, I'd like the language pack add-ons not to be installed out of the box.

The suggested scenario is to allow the administrator to manually install only the language packs the business needs, rather than having multiple unnecessary add-ons preinstalled.
fields.summary: Language pack add-ons should come uninstalled by default

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
"Contact the support team" link is not working and being redirect to an invalid page (404 error)
There is a problem with http://go.atlassian.com/versions-licenses-licensing-support redirection, thus, this is affecting all JIRA versions. 

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
Go to *Administration -> Applications* and click on the "Contact the support team" link on your right.

h3. *Expected Results*
Route you to support page.

h3. *Actual Results*
Route you to an invalid page, https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/5/create/36/ .
fields.summary: "Contact the support team" link is not working and being route to an invalid page (404 error)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Upgrading to an incompatible database is currently possible. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good for the JIRA installer to do a quick pre-upgrade platform check when it starts up, and warn the user if the current platforms (OS, DB, Java...) are no longer supported by the new version.
fields.summary: Supported Platform Check Pre-Upgrade

fields.description: The bundled version of atlassian-renderer in Atlassian JIRA before version 7.7.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a cross site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in nested wiki markup. For more information see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/RNDR-153 (currently restricted to Atlassian staff).
fields.summary: XSS in various types of nested wiki markup - CVE-2017-18102

fields.description: Various administrative external system import resources in Atlassian JIRA Server (including JIRA Core) before version 7.6.5, from version 7.7.0 before version 7.7.3, from version 7.8.0 before version 7.8.3 and before version 7.9.0 allow remote attackers to run import operations and to determine if an internal service exists through missing permission checks.
fields.summary: Missing authentication checks in various administrative system import resources - CVE-2017-18101

fields.description:
The agile wallboard gadget in Atlassian Jira before version 7.8.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a cross site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the name of quick filters.

h3. Workaround 
Disable the gadget. 
- Navigate to *Administration > Add-ons > Manage add-ons* and set the filter to show *Application Components*.
- Scroll down the list of plugins and expand *JIRA Agile*. 
- Click the "+" symbol next to the count of modules in this plugin to expand the list. 
- Scroll down until you find the *Agile board gadget* and set it to disabled.
fields.summary: XSS in the agile wallboard gadget through quick filter names - CVE-2017-18100

fields.description:
Currently there is no easy way to find out what filters are being used by what dashboard/gadgets. The only way is to perform a SQL query to search.

It would be better to have a tool or report to show what dashboard/gadget is using what filter.
fields.summary: Ability to identify which filters are being used by what dashboard/gadgets

fields.description:
*Problem:*

In advanced JQL query under "search for issues", Jira automatically displays the project names when search for "project =". 

*Feature request:*

Suggest to automatically display "project key" after search for "project=" or add "project key" as an option for search queries.
fields.summary: Adding project key in advanced JQL query

fields.description:
*Problem:* 

After renaming Jira project, all the associated filters/board queries doesn't get updated automatically. 

*Request:*

Jira should automatically update all associated filters/board queries after the project was renamed.
fields.summary: Change associated filter queries after renaming project

fields.description:
h3.Summary
After adding priorities in Jira (and ordering them), the Default Priority Scheme does not show them in the right order.

The *Priorities* screen in Jira administration states:

{quote}
The table below shows the priorities used in this version of Jira, in order from highest to lowest.
{quote}

and the Default Priority Scheme shows all priorities in Jira. The list shown in the *Priority Schemes* screen (for that Default Priority Scheme) and the list of priorities in projects _using_ the Default Priority Scheme is ordered by ID of the priority, rather than the order shown in the *Priorities* screen.

When using the Default Priority Scheme, Jira will pick the middle-ish (based on the number of priorities) and use that as the default.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Add a few extra priorities to Jira
# Change the order in a way that the newest is in the middle

h3. Expected results

The Default Priority Scheme and Priority Pickers display priorities in the same order as the Priorities Screen.

h3. Actual Results

The Default Priority Scheme and Priority Pickers display priorities based on their ID, rather than the order of the Priorities Screen.

h3. Workaround

Since this behaviour only affects the Default Priority Scheme, the best solution is to create a new Priority Scheme that has priorities in the correct order, and associate that scheme with each required project.

While it might be possible to adjust the default scheme in the database, in many cases it would be easier to simply create a new scheme, and use that (rather than attempting to adjust the default scheme.
fields.summary: Unable to order priorities in the Default Priority Scheme properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a user does not have "Browse User" permission but has "Assign Issue" permission can see all the users in the "Assignee field" while creating a new issue. This is causing a major concern with the GDPR.

h3. Steps To Reproduce
# Create a new User.
# Add the user to the Group which does not have "Browse User" Permission.
# Now give the same user Assign Issue Permission in a permission scheme.
# Create a new issue for the same project.
# Click on the Assignee field and list of all the users in JIRA will show up in the drop-down.

h3. Expected Behaviour
Only the members related to the particular project should show up in the list.

h3. Actual Behaviour
All JIRA user will show up in the drop-down irrespective of the project they are related to.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User with no "Browse User" Permission but with "Assign issues" permission, can view all users.

fields.description:
h3. Definition
Looking at this [link|https://www.atlassian.com/agile/tutorials/issues], there are a couple of useful features that will ease the board administrators to do their work. However, they are only available in Cloud instances. 

h3. Suggestion 
It would be great if these features will be implemented on servers too. 
!feature.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Board Quick Filter dropdown and Assignee Menu

fields.description:
It would be motivating to see an aesthetic change in the JIRA interface.
 We use the tool every day and we believe that the JIRA Cloud version is much better in its aesthetic aspect.

Thank you!

 

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/introducing-your-new-jira-experience-937886012.html]
fields.summary: Use the same user interface as in jira cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA XML API takes a long time to return XML data (JQL search result).

There are some integrations (Confluence gadgets ie) that utilize Jira XML API to search and retrieve issues from a filter:
* https://JIRA_URL/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml

The same JQL query based on a defined filter:
* takes around 30 seconds to gather data via XML API
* takes less than a few seconds via Jira UI.

Observable slowness is not related to enabled add-ons in Jira. Issue is not related to JQL complexity, however it's connected to custom fields usage in the query.
The slowness is related to XML API only, not the JQL itself.

h3. Environment

Jira > 7.0 versions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Execute a JQL query that contains any custom field via Jira XML API (searchRequest method):
* https://JIRA_URL/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml

h3. Expected Results

Execution time is equal (or is close) to the execution time of JQL through web UI.

h3. Actual Results

Execution time is significantly worse than the same JQL through web UI.

h3. Notes

Any integration with Jira XML API is affected (including Atlassian products)

h3. Workaround

No workaround found.
fields.summary: JIRA XML API takes a long time to return XML data (search request)

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Go to _Project Administration -> Issue Collectors -> Add Issue Collector_
 # Key in all the required field and click _Submit_

*Current Result:*
 - The page is refreshed and returns to the same page without any error message shown

*Expected Result:*
 - Issue Collector gets created

 

You cannot create an issue collector for this project, because the following fields are required on the project and those field types cannot be displayed to anonymous users. If the field is changed to be optional or a default value is provided, then an Issue Collector can be created for the project. Not allowed fields: Due Date

 

*Cause*
 - Due Date is set to "Required" in the project's field configuration.

*Workaround:*
 - Set Due Date to "optional"
fields.summary: Unable to create Issue Collectors, because of required fields not visible to anonymous users

fields.description:
Currently, JIRA server only allows a single storage path for attachments, however the content of the attachment tree consists of two distinct types of data. 

1) The actual attachments - these are not accessed frequently, so are ok to have on slower NAS storage. (Or on slower spinning disk vs SSD if you have on a server with flash.)

2) The thumbnails - these are accessed whenever someone opens the jira issue and it's displayed. They are also much smaller. 

Given this, it would be hugely beneficial to allow the thumbnails to be stored on a distinct path with different performance characteristics.
fields.summary: Allow specifying a different attachment storage path for thumbnails

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Multiple gadgets and reports such as Time Since Chart, Average Chart and etc will not load with the message "An internal server error occurred when requesting resource" shown instead.

h3. Environment
* Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 7.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to view a dashboard with a Time Since Chart

h3. Expected Results
The dashboard is displayed and all gadgets are rendered

h3. Actual Results
A 'An internal server error occurred when requesting resource' message is shown instead of the gadget.

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}


2017-09-04 19:54:11,205 http-nio-8080-exec-6 ERROR admin 1194x753x1 ae48vd 10.252.221.186,10.60.1.104 /rest/gadget/1.0/averageage/generate [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
at sun.font.CompositeStrike.getStrikeForSlot(CompositeStrike.java:75)
at sun.font.CompositeStrike.getFontMetrics(CompositeStrike.java:93)
at sun.font.Font2D.getFontMetrics(Font2D.java:415)
at java.awt.Font.defaultLineMetrics(Font.java:2176)
at java.awt.Font.getLineMetrics(Font.java:2246)
 
Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0 at sun.font.CompositeFont.getSlotFont(CompositeFont.java:351) at sun.font.CompositeGlyphMapper.initMapper(CompositeGlyphMapper.java:81) at sun.font.CompositeGlyphMapper.<init>(CompositeGlyphMapper.java:62) at sun.font.CompositeFont.getMapper(CompositeFont.java:409) at sun.font.StandardGlyphVector.init(StandardGlyphVector.java:1122) at sun.font.StandardGlyphVector
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The default font was changed from Utopia to Styx in RHEL 7.4, this is not handled well by the JVM and breaks functionality. For more information see [Bug 1484079 – AWT java apps fail to start when stix-fonts is used as sans-serif font|https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1484079]

h3. Workaround
# Stop Jira
# Create /etc/fonts/local.conf
# Paste the following:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
<?xml version='1.0'?>
<!DOCTYPE fontconfig SYSTEM 'fonts.dtd'>
<fontconfig>
  <alias>
    <family>serif</family>
    <prefer><family>Utopia</family></prefer>
  </alias>
  <alias>
    <family>sans-serif</family>
    <prefer><family>Utopia</family></prefer>
  </alias>
  <alias>
    <family>monospace</family>
    <prefer><family>Utopia</family></prefer>
  </alias>
  <alias>
    <family>dialog</family>
    <prefer><family>Utopia</family></prefer>
  </alias>
  <alias>
    <family>dialoginput</family>
    <prefer><family>Utopia</family></prefer>
  </alias>
</fontconfig>
{code}
# Save the file
# Start Jira

(!) If the above does not fix the issue, install the _dejavu-serif-fonts_ by running the following:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
sudo yum install dejavu-serif-fonts
{code}
fields.summary: Jira dashboard gadgets fail to render and instead display 'An internal server error occurred when requesting resource' error

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Visual or Comment does not render the formatting when the word is linked with other characters

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
* When you change from visual to text mode, there will be no problem. 
For example: 
** *H*ello (The "H" here is supposed to be bold) will be converted to the below without problem:
{code} *H*ello {code}
But when you save/share/comment, it will revert back to *H*ello. 
\\ \\ 
* But when you change from text to visual mode, you will need to separate the formatting. 
For example: 
** {code}[*H*ello] wouldn't work. {code}
** {code}[*H* ello] would work. (please take note of the space between *H* and e){code}

h3. *Expected Results*
The formatting works despite the character is linked to other characters or not. 

h3. *Actual Results*
The formatting is displayed as plain text just like in a text mode.

h3. *Workaround*
There is no workaround, but you can add a space behind to allow it to render properly. 

h3. *Update*
This is affecting -strike- , ~subscript~ , ^superscript^ , ??citation?? , {{monospaced}} as well.
fields.summary: Visual or Comment does not render the formatting when the word is linked with other characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we directly Copy (Ctrl+c) and Paste (Ctrl+v) any SQL script in the Visual Mode (in a code block) all the formatting is lost and the comment becomes a single comment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Save a SQL script as either .txt or .SQL on your computer.
# Open JIRA and click to put a comment.
# Switch from Text to Visual in the comment box.
# Type a code block.
# Now open the file (.Txt or .SQL) and *Copy the content using (Ctrl+c)* and *Paste* it into the comment code block *using (Ctrl+v)*.

h3. Expected Result 
The script will appear in the predefined format similar to as in the .txt /.sql file.
 !sql script format.PNG|thumbnail! 
h3.  Actual Result
The script lost its format and pasted shows up like a single line.
 !sql script.PNG|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
Use (Right Click+Copy) & (Right Click+Paste) for the copy-paste process.
fields.summary: Format is Lost when Copy and Paste in Visual Mode

fields.description:
h2. Description
Currently, there are two distinct process flow when creating issue from the "Create" button.
# Popup
This happens when left clicking on "Create" from any non-administration page in JIRA.
# 2-page process whereby the first page only has option for Project and Issue Type
This happens when left clicking on "Create" from administration page in JIRA, or, when right-click and open new tab is selected.

h2. Suggestion
Streamline the flow to be uniform. It is recommended to use the popup option as it is more convenient to use a 1-page form instead of 2-page form
fields.summary: Uniform process flow for issue creation

fields.description:
Currently, JIRA JQL Auto Complete fixVersion will only show a maximum of 17 suggested autocomplete list. It is suggested to list all suggestion to allow the user to select.

*Workaround*
# Key in the full fixVersion name.
fields.summary: JQL Auto Complete fixVersion Only Show Some of the Fix Version List

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, we could configure the following configuration when connecting JIRA to LDAP:
# Internal with LDAP Authentication where it will sync when the user is logging in.
# Microsoft Active Directory/LDAP where JIRA will automatically sync in the configured interval.

But, if one is already configured, to change the method on how JIRA sync the users, it is required to create a new directory for it. In the process, the group members could be missing as JIRA retaining it for each directory, forcing the users whether to create the membership over LDAP/AD side or mapping the users one by one on JIRA side that could take time.

h3. Suggested Solution:
To have a toggle which method that JIRA will use to sync towards that directory.
fields.summary: LDAP/AD Directory Configuration to add an option whether to choose "Internal with LDAP Authentication" or "LDAP/AD Integration"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Example implementation: [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/jira-drag-drop-attachments-plugin/src/master/plugin/src/main/resources/js/initIssueDropZone.js]
fields.summary: Add webpanel location to the Jira issue create dialog

fields.description:
h5. Problem
If multiple add-ons use the same function name, it can cause varying behaviours within Jira resulting in broken functionality, or partial functionality.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
* Install add-ons:  ScriptRunner and JQL Tricks
** Note that for JQL Tricks, it may request a follow-up action to "Configure their fields"
* Note that both add-ons add an  "hasLinks" JQL function to Jira
** https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/jql-functions.html#_haslinks
** https://www.j-tricks.com/jqlt-links-functions.html
* After add-ons are installed, attempt to use the "haslinks" functions from either add-on:
** ScriptRunner
{code}
issueFunction in hasLinks("blocks") 
{code}
** JQL Tricks
{code}
issue in hasLinks("blocks")﻿ 
{code}
* Note that both will fail and maybe even result in an ugly error for the end-user.

h5. Actual Results
Jira may have any of the following behaviours:
{code}
Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again.
{code}
or
500 error page
or
 !error.png|thumbnail! 
or maybe some unexpected behaviour
fields.summary: Jira Should Better Handle Functions that have the Same Name

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA does not have support for Oracle 12c Release 2. This proves to be problematic as this version of Oracle is the updated version, and some users may need to update to this version to receive support from Oracle.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Administrator/System Administrator is able to rename/delete existing workflow status, despite it currently being used by workflow(s). This can be a problem since the changes will take effect to all the workflows that are using the affected status.

h3. Suggested Solution
Prevent the ability to rename/delete status that is currently being used in workflows. 

Alternatively, add a confirmation pop screen when change is about to be made to a status that is being used by a workflow. The pop-up screen serves to be a second confirmation and will list out the workflows that are currently using the status.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Restrict renaming existing Workflow Status for JIRA Administrator/System Administrators

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
In the visual mode of a comment in issue, users can input many empty/blank lines after a comment causing it to occupy the space and impacting the issue viewing experience. These trailing empty/blank lines serve no purpose in comment content or formatting as this is an inappropriate typing behavior of users. 

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Add a filtering to the comment to remove the trailing empty/blank lines.

This will result in a neat and cleaner viewing experience when other users reading through the comments.

Creating custom filter and sharing will required users to look it up. In other words, it will be another step for each users. 

h3. *Suggested Solution*
Allow JIRA admins to add default filter such as "Open Issues" filter that affect the whole JIRA is better than sharing filter. 

h3. *Why this is important*
This will save a lot of time for other users to look for the shared filter which could be added up as a big chunk of time from business perspective.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, we do have the information about ["Pros and Cons of Cloud vs. Server"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/pros-and-cons-of-cloud-vs-server-691011844.html] but this does not list the difference between the two products, giving the impression that both are the same. Some example of the differences are:
# External Directory integration only available for version.
# Some workflow functions are available only for Cloud.
# JIRA related features that are available in Cloud but not Server.

h3. Suggested Solution:
* To have one centralized page where users can refer to on what are the differences between the JIRA Cloud and Server.

h3. Why is it needed?
* This is to prevent confusion of what is available between the two when users are moving to Server from Cloud or vice versa where they will realize that some feature is not available after the migration. Also, to prevent any impression that JIRA Cloud and Server are the same.
fields.summary: List the differences between JIRA Cloud and Server

fields.description:
Here is our situation:
 # We are always approaching the scaling limits of JIRA DC
 # We would like to offload read-only reporting to a replica of our prod JIRA DB
 # A number of tools can connect directly to the database, such as Tableau, MS Dynamics, and homegrown reporting tools
 ## When they do this, they completely bypass any security set up around JIRA projects and issues
 ## The security team is balking at this, for now this is a dead end
 ## These tools can usually also use the prod API, impacting performance.

What would address this situation:
 # A “mirror” of prod JIRA that can talk to a read-only database
 ## This would all reports to be generated against our read-only replica database
 ## For most purposes, it could be headless, just an API, though UI would be helpful, too
 ## This addresses the tool integrations that can use the API.
 # We still don’t know how to solve the problem for tools that can only function with a direct connection to the db.
 # It is possible that you could provide a db view that is limited to specific projects, according to our DBA, but this appears to be very difficult.

What else this could provide:
 # A mirror read-only replica in India or Europe would speed up reports run there
 # EazyBI and other plugins could add config options that let them point to the read-only replica db
 ## This would be especially helpful if the mirror is API only.

Many others provide this, and so should Atlassian. Needless to say, this would be useful right now, and are looking at all avenues to reduce load on our DC cluster. Maybe there are other ways to address our use case.
fields.summary: Read-Only JIRA

fields.description:
I'm committed to using Jira but I hate *how many clicks* are required in order to achieve small things. Here are some of the things I've noticed, I wonder if you have any plan to improve on these in the future, or whether anyone has suggestions for easier workarounds?

*Changing a workflow*
This small change took me about 30 minutes because apparently, you can't change an active workflow.. goodness knows why not. I thought this was supposed to be agile?

My workaround was to clone the workflow and then I had to clone the workflow, make the changes and then reassign all my projects to the new workflow.

*No Scrum Templates* JSWSERVER-6790
We should really be able to set up a project template and use that going forward. My current workaround (probably about 100 clicks)
 * Create New Project (in order for the Filter to be set up)
 * Delete the newly created Board
 * Make a copy of my Template Board
 * Rename the new Board
 * Change Saved Filter of the new board to the one that was originally created.
 * Change the Workflow scheme to use my default one in Admin Settings > Workflow Schemes
 * Delete the workflow in Admin Settings > Workflow

*Multi-Issue editing*
When working on the backlog I often want to create a batch of tasks and then divvy it up between the team. So I would like to be able to select multiple issues and quickly assign them to multiple users. I can already select multiple issues but if I assign it to a user then it only assigns one of them. Why do I have to go through the whole process of bulk editing issues just to add an assignee? 

*Bulking Editing Process*
This process is quite time-consuming, I have to search for the issues that I want to change. Click bulk edit. Confirm that I want to change the issues that I have just searched for. Select the type of change. Make the changes. Confirm again. And then acknowledge.

Ideally I after searching the issues and clicking bulk edit, I should be able to choose what I want to change, then see the list of issues (ideally with a git type view of the changes) and then confirm, and be taken back to my search. 

*Bulk adding of stories*
This is currently my biggest frustration at the moment. Maybe I'm missing something but the only way I can add multiple issues is by doing a CSV import which takes about 20 clicks. My current workaround is that I have created a beta agile board and from there I can paste a clipboard full of tasks separated by a line break. The popup comes up to ask me if I want to create multiple issues. Then I go into the search and go through the still somewhat tedious process of bulk moving them into the correct project. Ideally, I would love the same multiple add popup to appear in all of the backlogs.

*Better use of right click*
I've only been using Jira for 2 days now but if I look I'll be able to find 100 examples of places where this can be used to eliminate clicks. But I'll give one quick example:
 * *Adding an icon to a project*
From the projects page, I first have to click on a project, wait for the 5 second load time and then can click on settings, why not have a right-click menu on the projects page that allows me to go straight to the projects settings page, thus saving me 5 seconds and saving your servers the unnecessary load time, which will help someone else's request take 4 seconds instead of 5. **

*Can't import story points*
Not sure why but I don't seem to be able to import story points or much else for that matter, it would be nice to be able to Create an Epic while I'm importing stories. Also would be nice to be able to label when the issue being imported is a story or a bug. Also, it would be nice when matching the assignee to either have a tip for what I am supposed to use. IE. the username. Or better a drop-down of the users.

*User Dropdown*
The user dropdown is very unfriendly. Firstly it should dropdown straight away when I click assignee. Also, I have to look at all of the plugins I've added before seeing the actual users on the site. That doesn't really make sense.

*Keyboard Shortcuts*
 * *Weird keyboard shortcuts*
ST, SB to move to the top or button... Why not Shift+Ctrl+ Up / Down


 * *Adding story points when in the backlog*
I have to do this one by one. Firstly the multi assignment is missing. Secondly, why not set up a quick keyboard shortcut to add a priority. Tab + 5 to add 5 story points for example.


 * *Changing priority when in the backlog*
Again keyboard shortcuts would be great. Something like Alt+Up / Down to increase or decrease the priority.
**
 * *More Shortcuts*
Since I've only just started using the system these are just a few I've noticed, I'm sure I will notice many more opportunities in the future. 
Here is a really great example of some really powerful shortcuts. https://asana.com/guide/help/faq/shortcuts

 

I really love your system. But there are so many small changes that can be made that will make the system much easier to use. I wish you would consider these updates.
fields.summary: Navigating through stories is not user friendly

fields.description:
Use case:

Customer/reporter submits an request on the JSD portal or they have rights to view the request on the portal. Customer/reporter has to scroll all to find what the original issue is really about. 

Not all reporters will submit a request that actually details what the issue is about. For example we have reporters that will have one word in the subject. We have had users complain it is very hard and inconvenient to for them to have to scroll to the bottom of the page to find out the description off issue.
fields.summary: Make it so the Description is pinned to the top of a request in the JSD Portal

When no login into JIRA and we access to a attachment direct download link (Attachment Name with spaces only impacted), JIRA will ask for login and then redirected to Dashboard without download the attachment.

JIRA Version : Tested on JIRA 7.5.3

# Upload an attachment which attachment name contain space such as test document.msg
# Copy the direct link to download the attachment
# Logout / Open a incognito windows.

fields.description:
As far as I know, Jira started as a bug tracking system and not evolved into Project Tracking tool. There is not doubt that Jira is one of the greatest tools in the industry and I have been using it for several years and proposed to many Project Teams and Organizations.

The keyword "Issue" is misleading because it's actual meaning is an issue or a bug or an error in the system.

Techies can understand that "Issue" refers to a work item that can a Task, Epic, Story or a Bug whereas End Users and new users of Jira are getting confused most of the times and leading unnecessary discussion.

 

In order to be Unique, the keyword "Issue" should be renamed to "Work Item" and no one can get confused.
fields.summary: Keyword "Issue" is misleading

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This bug is the same behavior described in JRASERVER-45609.

There is a comment in the ticket as follows.

{quote}
This bug is not reproducible in JIRA 7.0.0. Both add-ons (JIRA Misc Workflow Extensions and JIRA Suite Utilities) work fine, the test result is as expected.

"Error is displayed and the display of the new assignee has now changed from full name format "Carmen Salas" to username format "csalas""

This is true when the assignee is changed and user clicks on the button to complete the transition WITHOUT the comment. However, once the cursor is placed on the Comment field or anywhere blank on the screen and click, the name format will be displayed in the full name format i.e. "Carmen Salas". User then insert the comment and click on the button to complete the transition, the status and assignee will be changed accordingly.
{quote}

The statement seems to be almost true but I found a bit different behavior in Jira Core 7.8.1.
I meant the following behavior.

bq. once the cursor is placed on the Comment field or anywhere blank on the screen and click, the name format will be displayed in the full name format i.e. "Carmen Salas".

It never happened and we need to click *Assignee* field on the screen to display the assignee in the full name format. (That's why JRASERVER-45609 was reproduced on Jira Core 7.8.1.)

Please see the "Steps to reproduce" section for the details.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create users as follows
#- username: aaa, full name: AAA
#- username: bbb, full name: BBB
# Create a text field (e.g. "test") and set the field mandatory
# Add the field to a screen
# Set the screen as a transition screen of a transition
# Open an issue which uses the transition
# Set the assignee as "aaa" user
# Hit the transition button on the issue page
#- the transition screen should be shown in this step
# Change Assignee field to "bbb"
#- the assignee should be displayed in the full name format like "BBB"
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Make sure "test" field is empty
# Try to fire the transition
#- the transition should fail as the mandatory field "test" was empty
# Make sure Assignee field is displayed in the user name format like "bbb"
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Fill in "test" field (Please don't close the transition screen before filling in the field)
# Fire the transition

h3. Expected Results

The assignee should be changed to "bbb".

h3. Actual Results

The assignee was still "aaa".

h3.Workaround

Edit Assignee field directly.
fields.summary: Issue reassignment is not recognized during transition when transition includes required fields

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import data from Redmine using External System Import.
# All the users from Redmine was supposed to be set as inactive.
{code}
2018-03-30 10:46:38,307 INFO - Imported user adminredmine adminredmine (adminredmine) as an inactive
2018-03-30 10:46:38,343 INFO - Imported user redmine1 redmine1 (redmine1) as an inactive
2018-03-30 10:46:38,378 INFO - User: redmine2 added to 1 groups: redmine-import-unused-users
2018-03-30 10:46:38,378 INFO - Imported user redmine2 redmine2 (redmine2) as an inactive

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

A Jira project admin following the steps in [Running a Bamboo build when releasing a version| https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/running-a-bamboo-build-when-releasing-a-version-764478184.html] are able to trigger Bamboo builds even without application access to Bamboo. The documentation states the only requirement is as follow: 

* You must be a project administrator for the project that the version is in. See Permissions overview for more information.

h3. Suggested Solution

Builds should respect permissions in Bamboo. Either the release build dialogue doesn't appear at all, or there are no plans listed under the plans dropdown.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Bamboo builds from within Jira should not be allowed from project admins without application access to Bamboo

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some project configuration requires the Versions and Releases to be managed by users that are not supposed to be able to administer the project. JIRA is unable to do so because one will need Project Administer Permission to be able to create new Versions and Releases.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a separate Project Permission for Versions and Releases that are not dependent to the Project Administer project

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Separate Project Permission for Versions and Releases

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The way atlassian-cache API is build (cache is remote by default) results in large number of cache replication events. This is not always necessary, as some of the information is local to the node and does not have to be replicated. 
h3. Expected Results

Jira Data Center replicates only information important cluster-wide. Information that is local to nodes is not replicated. 
h3. Actual Results

Identified caches that do not have to be replicated as information stored in them is important to user being logged in on current node. Some of the offending caches that are responsible for large number of replications: OfBizUserDao.userAttributesCache
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Jira Data Center generates too many cache replication events for some caches due to wrong remote policy

fields.description:
[Configuring JIRA Data Center on AWS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver076/configuring-jira-data-center-on-aws-945110913.html] presently recommends the use of c3 instance types for Jira Data Center. The c3 instance type has been deprecated by Amazon in favor of the new c5 instance type (see [https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/previous-generation/]).

Please review and update the documentation and the Quick Start templates to reflect these more recent instance types.
fields.summary: Update AWS instance type recommendations

fields.description:
As indicated in the guide *[How to Configure an Outbound HTTP and HTTPS Proxy for JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-configure-an-outbound-http-and-https-proxy-for-jira-applications-247857187.html]:*
{quote}This Outbound Proxy configuration only works for HTTP and HTTPs request only. If you are trying to connect JIRA to a Mail Server (Gmail or Office365) or to an LDAP Server, this configuration will not work.{quote}

The suggestion is to improve the Email server configuration (both incoming and outgoing) so the it works using the proxy like any other Jira function when an outbound proxy is configured.

A reason for this limitation seems to be related to the version of JavaMail implemented in Jira, as support for proxy in JavaMail [according to their FAQ|https://javaee.github.io/javamail/FAQ#proxy], is in version 1.6 and newer, while the one implemented in Jira is 1.5.6 (as of Jira Core 7.8).
fields.summary: Improve the Email server configuration (incoming or outgoing) to be able to use outbound proxy
Improve error message when a ticket is not created by email

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
The user wants the ability to edit the content of the get local help function to configure the details within the local help suiting more towards the projects being displayed in the JIRA application, therefore the potential change in information visible to the users when hovering over the get local help buttons.

h3. *Expected Results*
To be able to edit and configure the content of the Get Local Help to be personalized to the projects and content of the instance.

h3. *Actual Results*
The Get Local Help is default with fixed locations and fixed information which applies to the general data which can lead to confusion if some data is changed.
fields.summary: Ability to Edit The Get Local Help Option In JIRA

fields.description:
When a staging version of Jira is created from a production instance certain changes to the configuration have to be made as outlined here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/establishing-staging-server-environments-for-jira-applications-802592273.html]

It might be a good idea in a future version of Jira to be able to set the instance in staging mode from the Admin interface which would remove the need to edit config files.

Nick
fields.summary: Staging setting

fields.description:
A beneficial enhancement would be if the Administrator could defined additional tabs under Activity for the user to add information and upload documents and files.

At the same token, the Create screen for issues is to static. The Administrator is unable to adjust the screen to add additional tabs and sections with different field types (numeric, varchar, list of value, check box).

If would be helpful if the screen could be customized and configured by an Administrator to add sections with custom fields and additional tabs. Many software allows the Administrator or user to define the layout of the screen to make the input more customize with templates and predefined information from pick lists and predefined checkbooks.This would make Jira a better software support application.

Regards,

Andreas
fields.summary: Activity: Flexible Create User form with user defined TABS - SECTIONS - CUSTOM FIELDS

fields.description:
Today everybody can see time estimates made on an issue. It would be nice if it was possible (for example via the permission scheme) to determine who should be able see them.

An idea to the level of permissions could be:
 - Edit others time estimates
 - Add/Edit own time estimates
 - View time estimates

 # The agency wants to be able to control who can see any time estimation and tracking information, such as customers (likely not), internal project management (rather yes) etc.
 # In some circumstances, this information is sensitive and needs to be handled accordingly.
fields.summary: Hide Time Tracking estimates from certain users (e.g. customers)
